Learn More & Join Download Assignment PDF Before You Shoot â€¢ Research local customs and laws regarding photography in public spaces. â€¢ Select a compact camera or a lens that allows for discreet shooting. â€¢ Plan your shooting location and time for optimal lighting conditions. â€¢ Prepare your camera settings in advance to minimize adjustments during shooting. â€¢ Practice zone focusing techniques to capture spontaneous moments effectively. The Assignment Technical Focus â€¢ Use aperture priority mode at f/4.0, shutter speed 1/250s, ISO 200 for sharp images in varying light conditions. â€¢ Set your camera to continuous focus mode to track moving subjects effectively. â€¢ Utilize a white balance setting of 'Daylight' for shooting in natural light to preserve color accuracy. â€¢ Experiment with metering modes; use spot metering to expose correctly for subjects in shadowed areas. â€¢ Adjust exposure compensation to +1/3 to prevent highlights from blowing out in bright sunlight. Creative Focus â€¢ Seek out interesting backgrounds that complement your subjects to create depth in your images. â€¢ Look for leading lines in the environment to draw the viewer's eye into the photograph. â€¢ Capture candid moments by anticipating gestures and emotions that tell a story. â€¢ Utilize reflections in windows or puddles for a creative twist on traditional street scenes. â€¢ Experiment with different angles and perspectives to add variety to your compositions. Assignment Tasks â€¢ Photograph street vendors at a local market using settings f/5.6, 1/125s, ISO 400 in aperture priority mode to capture vibrant colors and details. â€¢ Capture a series of candid portraits of passersby at a busy intersection with settings f/2.8, 1/500s, ISO 800 to achieve a shallow depth of field. â€¢ Document street performers in action using settings f/4.0, 1/250s, ISO 200 in manual mode to freeze motion while maintaining good exposure. â€¢ Shoot a bustling street scene during sunset using settings f/8, 1/60s, ISO 100 to create a sense of atmosphere with warm light. â€¢ Photograph an interesting architectural feature with pedestrians interacting around it using settings f/11, 1/125s, ISO 400 to maintain focus throughout the scene. â€¢ Create a photo essay of local culture by capturing various aspects of street life, using settings f/5.6, 1/250s, ISO 400 to maintain consistency. ðŸ’¡ Stretch Tasks â€¢ Conduct an in-depth photo project focusing on a specific neighborhood, utilizing varied camera settings to document the area's unique character and stories. â€¢ Create a time-lapse series of a busy street corner over a few hours, adjusting settings dynamically to capture the changing light and activity.
